data.text: Remember to save the project as you write! (I'm writing this tutorial a second time)

When creating your own collection box you can let your imagination loose. This is your canvas. You can italicize or embolden the text. There are multiple highlighters available as well. To do so highlight the text and choose the marker tool
You can add a beautiful link to your collection box by first writing the word that will have the link, then highlight it and click the link icon above it.
A few things to make your collection box attract more donations

items: Write personally about why this particular charity appeals to you.
Make use of highlights, photos, lists, tables etc. The website design is quite minimalistic so you can make your collection box stand out.
Include stories about particular people/families that the charity of your choice has helped. This will allow the reader to better visualize the impact of their donation.

data.text: A table can be useful to show some data (it loads a lot faster than a photo)
An inspiring and relevant quote can make a significant decision on the potential donors decision

data.text: Giving does not only precede receiving; it is the reason for it. It is in giving that we receive.
Checklists can show things that were already completed by the charity and show what they need funds to accomplish.

items.text: Create the most beautiful and persuasive collection box I can imagine (I believe in you :)

data.text: Images that show the readers how the charity impacts peoples lives are a good idea. Don't include too many images or use too high quality (640x480 is perfectly fine) because they will take a lot of time to load which can make readers leave before the website finishes loading. The Unsplash images may not work until my app gets approval for higher usage.

There are some limitations on where your images can be hosted because they need to be available publicly without any intermediate steps. For example hosting them on Google Drive doesn't work. I verified that hosting them on Imgur works fine. After uploading the photo to Imgur you can grab the link by clicking on the image in your gallery with right mouse button and clicking the "copy image address" button.
